result.execSummary:
The defendant Judd Edward Bergfeld was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All but 14 days of jail time is stayed
All but $900.00 of fine/costs/surcharges is stayed totaling $2242.00

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall comply with requirements and satisfactorily complete Crawford County Drug/Alcohol Treatment Court.

timeConds.notes: Huber/electronic monitoring allowed after first 48 hours

records.addlTxt:
2:11 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Judd Edward Bergfeld in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Judd Edward Bergfeld.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. 
Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY
Court accepts the defendants plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant GUILTY 

Atty. Steiner is heard on sentence - recommends 185 days jail, $2400 plus costs blood draw $120. 36 mo. DL revocation. If placed in Treatment court - all but 14days be stayed and fine being reduced to $900.00 or all but $900 be stayed, 3 years probation with condition that def. participate in and successfully complete Treatment Court

Atty Key is heard on sentence - shares Atty. Steiner's recommendations - requests Treatment Court, all but 14 days jail be stayed.

Comments by Defendant on sentence

Court sentences def to 185 days jail, fine of $2400.00 plus $1626. costs & surcharges, $50 IID fee, $120 Blood draw fee. $4196 total 
36 month DL rev., Sentence is imposed and stayed, def. is placed on probation for 2 yrs, all but $900.00 fine is stayed ($900.00 plus costs/surcharges & blood tests totaling $2192), all but 14 days jail are stayed.  the 14 days jail def. electronic monitoring is allowed after first 48 hours. . Alcohol Assessment and DSP.
IID for 36 mos., 60 DTP, conditions of probation - participate in and successfully complete Crawford Co. Treatment Court program

1 day jail credit if revoked
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Treatment Court Letter

Attorney Key is heard on the status of the case. Requests a plea and sentencing.
